title: Bug 6410 - File dirtied by code assist even though it remains unchanged
description: Bug 6410 - File dirtied by code assist even though it remains unchanged
OB: When a Java file is opened and the cursor is placed inside the leftmost parenthesis of a method call, pressing Ctrl+Space to trigger code assist does not work. Additionally, the file is marked as 'dirtied' even though no changes have been made to it.
EB: Code assist should function as expected when pressing Ctrl+Space inside the leftmost parenthesis of a method call. The file should not be marked as 'dirtied' if no changes have been made.
SR: To reproduce the issue: 1. Open a Java file. 2. Place the cursor inside the leftmost parenthesis of a method call. For example, consider 'I' to be the cursor below: Object o = anotherObject.method(I); 3. Press Ctrl+Space to trigger code assist. Note the absence of code assist and the file being marked as 'dirtied' even though it remains unchanged.
